name: choco-source
description: Runs Chocolatey Source with specified parameters
author: gep13

inputs.name: operation
inputs.label: Source Operation
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose whether to add, remove, enable or disable a source.

inputs.name: sourceName
inputs.label: Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name to give the Source.

inputs.name: source
inputs.label: Source
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name to give the Source.

inputs.name: priority
inputs.label: Priority
inputs.helpMarkDown: The priority order of this source as compared to other sources, lower is better. Defaults to 0 (no priority). All priorities above 0 will be evaluated first, then zero-based values will be evaluated in config file order.

inputs.name: password
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: The user's password to the source. Encrypted in chocolatey.config file.

inputs.name: cert
inputs.label: Client Certificate
inputs.helpMarkDown: PFX pathname for an x509 authenticated feeds.

inputs.name: certpassword
inputs.label: Certificate Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: the client certificate's password to the source.

inputs.name: verbose
inputs.label: Show verbose messaging.
inputs.helpMarkDown: Very verbose messaging, avoid using under normal circumstances.

inputs.name: trace
inputs.label: Show trace messaging.
inputs.helpMarkDown: Very, very verbose trace messaging. Avoid except when needing super low-level .NET Framework debugging.

inputs.name: bypassproxy
inputs.label: Bypass Proxy.
inputs.helpMarkDown: Should this source explicitly bypass any explicitly or system configured proxies?

inputs.name: extraArguments
inputs.label: Extra Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional Chocolatey Arguments that are not catered for above.
